comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0)
Build Identifier: 4.0.1

When you zoom in on a page, it may not always display the CSS accordingly when JavaScript functions for width and height-changing have been used. For instance, if you create a div-block and change the width and height of the div-block in an animation and you then zoom in on the block in may not have been drawn right; once you refresh it paints the block right again. IE9 doesn't seem to have this issue.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Check JavaScript menu's or components that have been build with JavaScript (changing CSS-properties).
2. Zoom in with Firefox.
3. Refresh (this should fix it)


Expected Results:  
No refresh needed but always displaying accordingly whether zoom or not.
